intro: Worcesterianthus magallanensis, commonly known as the Magallanes chilean bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils and maritime climates. It has slender, branching stems and small, hairy leaves. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after plant for gardens in temperate regions.
